alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Latimer; Muskogee; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 9:10AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Muskogee and Sequoyah. In southeast Oklahoma, Haskell and Latimer. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 910 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated areas of moderate to heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sallisaw... Stigler... Vian... Keota... Red Oak... Mccurtain... Whitefield... Kinta... Marble City... Tamaha... Mc Curtain... Lequire... Brushy Lake State Park... Kanima... Mc Key... Box... Lewisville... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
